item.title: how-not-to-blunder-a-lucky-life
item.description: The secret is to grind in ignorance to the abundance your prior grinding may have brought you. Grind as if you had nothing, always. Grind unconditionally.

item.title: judgement
item.description: Every judgement you make will set you back. It’s similar to assumptions. Don’t be judgemental, be curious.

item.title: assumptions
item.description: Every assumption you make will set you back. It’s similar to judgement.

item.title: hedonic
item.description: Describes something which eventually reverts back to the mean. For example “happiness is hedonic—once the novelty wears off” .

item.title: monotonically increase
item.description: Things which are guaranteed to stay the same or increase—they will never decrease. For example, .

item.title: Conversion rate
item.description: Like it or not, we keep subconsciously keep track of people’s conversion rate. While this can mean different things, it is most commonly the frequency with which they follow through on things that they promise, or things that we ask of them.

item.title: likeability
item.description: The amount that you like someone is some result of your subconscious keeping track of the following: Their conversion rate The number of times they have made you laugh ...

item.title: Is there a word for X?
item.description: A The sadness of knowing you will never get to visit every restaurant in the world, know every person, or walk down every alleyway. - Tends to manifest while traveling e.g.

item.title: iteration
item.description: Iteration is such a beautiful concept. The idea of repeatedly giving love to the same thing… In such a way as to make it better each time. A mechanism through which you can (almost) guarantee to improve something.

item.title: vitamins
item.description: Vitamins are hard because unlike painkillers, it is extremely hard to observe their effects at all or even verify that they are making a difference. While painkillers have a very easy reminder (pain itself), vitamins rely entirely on consistency and routine, and will otherwise not be taken.
